intro: Wendlandia paniculata var. genuina, commonly known as the pink devil's ivy, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, delicate flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a slightly hairy texture. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of growing conditions.
